channel.title: Running games from external harddrive?
channel.description: I'm just wondering if it's possible to run games, e.g Counterstrike, from an external harddrive? Also, will this affect the speed of it?

item.title: Running games from external harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:13, topic:268299”][quote author=sppt link=topic=354105.msg2713724#msg2713724 date=1237498135]
It will work, but if you got a crap CPU, you’ll probably notice it, because when you read from a USB drive, it takes some CPU time to read it.
Then again, if the game(you lost it) loads everything into RAM, it won’t be noticable, unless it has to load stuff.

edit: I’m pretty sure my Oblivion install won’t cache everything into ram, I checked out the total size of my data folder, and it’s like 24 gb with all my mods, so I doubt it’d get loaded into RAM… hehe.
That’s one game I wouldn’t put on an external
[/quote]
Thats why theres Areas/Levels/Maps, the entire oblivion map obviously doesn’t not get cached But everything needed, or the areas you see does.[/quote]
And that’s why playing Oblivion on an external would suck.

Read full topic

item.title: Running games from external harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

It will work, but if you got a crap CPU, you’ll probably notice it, because when you read from a USB drive, it takes some CPU time to read it.
Then again, if the game(you lost it) loads everything into RAM, it won’t be noticable, unless it has to load stuff.

edit: I’m pretty sure my Oblivion install won’t cache everything into ram, I checked out the total size of my data folder, and it’s like 24 gb with all my mods, so I doubt it’d get loaded into RAM… hehe.
That’s one game I wouldn’t put on an external

Read full topic

item.title: Running games from external harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:9, topic:268299”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=354105.msg2713422#msg2713422 date=1237482509]
Honestly, I don’t think it’s a good idea; just strange imo. Does it work? duh; are speeds slower? duh; does it really matter? not really, most games cache everything into RAM.
[/quote]

I only have a 120gb internal hdd on my laptop, so installing games and putting all my downloads on my external hdd is almost a must. I only install stuff I need on at school on my internal hdd, like office.[/quote]
Yup, this is why I need to do it to.

Read full topic

item.title: Running games from external harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

T4_:

Honestly, I don’t think it’s a good idea; just strange imo. Does it work? duh; are speeds slower? duh; does it really matter? not really, most games cache everything into RAM.

I only have a 120gb internal hdd on my laptop, so installing games and putting all my downloads on my external hdd is almost a must. I only install stuff I need on at school on my internal hdd, like office.

item.title: Running games from external harddrive?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

la­wl:

it will work, but if you are going to try to use it on a computer that you didnt install it on, you might have to set some reg keys

Most games do not care about REG keys.
Sims 2 do, so that will not work on an other computer.

Read full topic
